column4: hey, could someone help me out with this. i was here yesterday and tried what was suggested and no go. im trying to upgrade to ubuntu 8.04 from 7.10 and 2 pkgs wont download
would you know where the pkgs get downloaded to when upgrading?
packages are downloaded to /var/cache/apt/archives/ but that isn't relelvant, you shouldn't need to do any manual package...stuff.
yea i know but maybe thinking i can download those from somewhere else and put them there. cause the servers wont let me download them.
What are the errors you get?

i dont get errors, it hangs on those 2 packages. and downloading stops. i then cancel and it tells me they couldnt be fetched. i've left it on half the night and they didnt download. together they are like 700kb only
Which packages? and do you have any third party repos enabled?
yea under software sources i got 3rd party software both boxes checked
alright, it's possible that those are the causes of this issue. Uncheck them and see if that helps.
ok i'll try it now. im using the ca.ubuntu server
hmm seems to have stopped again with 1165 of 1167 pkgs downloaded :-/
i can cancel and tell you what they are
sure, you could try downloading them manually.
when i go and try and download it from firefox, it doesnt download either with that address but says its there
Try changing your mirror, from ca, although I can download them fine.  In your browser, take that URL and remove the ca. from it (so http://archive.ubuntu.com....)
